name: Southeast Asian Culture and History [1] Online Quiz | World | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is not a tongue of the Austro-Asiatic family?
Which of the following tongues is most closely related to Malay?
questions.explanation:
Tagalog.

	Malay and Tagalog are both Austronesian languages.

questions.text: In Southeast Asia rice paddies are often referred to by which of the following words?
'Swidden' is another name for what type of agriculture, common in Southeast Asia?
What is the term for the system of unwritten customary law that guided people's lives in the Malay speaking pre-modern world?
Which of the following is not a term for a village headman in Southeast Asia?
questions.explanation:
cacique.

	Cacique was the name for the economic elite of rural Philippine society. Xa truong (Vietnam), Penghulu (Malay) and Datu (Philippine) were all terms for village headmen.

questions.text: Traditionally, what color robes did buddhist monks usually wear in Vietnam?
questions.explanation:
brown.

	Traditionally, Theravada monks wear yellow or orange-saffron robes, while Mahayana monks wear brown. Vietnamese Buddhism is Mahayanist, thus the brown robes.

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in the Vietnamese 'tam giao' or 'three religions'?
questions.explanation:
Hinduism.

	The Vietnamese received the 'tam giao' from their northern neighbor China. Hinduism really never made a deep impression on traditional Vietnamese culture.

questions.text: What is the 'sangha' in Southeast Asia?
options: The series of rice terraces found on mountain slopes
The sea trade on the South China sea
The set of rules imposed by colonial rulers

questions.text: What was the term for the 'God-King' who ruled over all during the Angkor period of Cambodian history?
questions.explanation:
devaraja.

	Suryavarman and Indravarman were both devarajas.
